<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="final-qualifying-examination-for-certificate-in-community-health-nursing">FINAL QUALIFYING EXAMINATION FOR CERTIFICATE IN COMMUNITY HEALTH NURSING<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#final-qualifying-examination-for-certificate-in-community-health-nursing" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<p>PAPER: MIDWIFERY</p>
<p>DATE: 18th JANUARY, 2022
TIME: 3 HOURS (9:00AM – 12:00 NOON)</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="instructions">INSTRUCTIONS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#instructions" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>This paper consists of:</li>
</ol>
<ul>
<li>Section 1 (40 Multiple Choice Questions)</li>
<li>Section 2 (8 Short Answer Questions)</li>
<li>Section 3 (1 Long Answer Question)</li>
</ul>
<ol start="2">
<li>
<p>Attempt ALL Questions</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Write the EXAMINATION NUMBER given on all the answer sheets provided and on the question paper.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Ensure that all examination answer scripts are handed in at the end of the examination</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Ensure you sign the examination register provided</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>EXAMINATION NUMBER: [1] (NUR) FEB-22 | FQE |</p>
<p>Page 1 of 7</p>
<p>KMTC/QP-8/EPS</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="midwifery">MIDWIFERY<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#midwifery" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="section-1-multiple-choice-questions-40-marks">SECTION 1: MULTIPLE CHOICE QUESTIONS (40 MARKS)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#section-1-multiple-choice-questions-40-marks" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>
<p>In shoulder dystocia the cardial sign is:
a) No fetal advancement
b) Turtule sign
c) Macrosomic baby
d) face flushing</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Zavanelli is one of the last resort maneuver in shoulder dystocia, it means
a) Cutting the fetal head
b) Breaking the symphysis
c) Returning the fetal head back to the uterus
d) Allowing normal labor after fetal death</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The denominator in face presentation is
a) Sacrum
b) Mentum
c) Occiput
d) Sincipit</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>State true or false
i) Human milk is the gold standard for nutrition of the human infant
ii) The Mnemonic AVPU in maternal resuscitation means; Alert, Voice, Pain, Unconscious</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>A mother came for antenatal visit on 4/8/2021 with an LMP of 3/2/2021, what is her maturity by date:-
a) 26/40 weeks
b) 32/40 weeks
c) 24/40 weeks
d) 28/40 weeks</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The management of a mother in first stage of labour with placenta previa type two posterior is:
a) Allow progress to normal vaginal birth
b) Emergency Cesarean Section
c) Elective Cesarean Section
d) Await the obstetrician to make decision</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>During an antenatal clinic the mother reports painless per vaginal bleeding. The most likely diagnosis would be
a) Placenta previa
b) Placenta abruption
c) Ruptured vasa previa
d) Placenta acretta</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The hormonal factors responsible for uterine contractions at the onset of labour are:
a) Increase release of oxytocin and progesterone from decidua at term
b) Formation of oxytocin and oestrogen in the fetal circulation
c) Rise of oxytocin and oestrogen in the fetal circulation
d) Optimum levels of oestrogen and rise of prostaglandins in maternal circulation</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Continuity of care of a postnatal mother after discharge mainly depends on:-
a) The number of postnatal clinic the midwife can make
b) The availability of health facility
c) The ability of the midwife to detect problems and intervene</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>KMTC/QP-8/EPS</p>
<p>d) The adequate health messages shared with the mother</p>
<ol start="10">
<li>Which one of the following is an indication for giving cardiopulmonary resuscitation in an adult?</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Absence of breathing in the presence of an open airway
b) Presence of circulation in the absence of breathing
c) Presence of circulation in the presence of weak chest movements
d) Patient subconscious in the absence of a defibrillator</p>
<ol start="11">
<li>The reproductive tract fistulae are caused by</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Prolonged labor, Multiple pregnancy
b) Un attended obstructed labor, prolonged labor
c) Surgical injuries, IUCD
d) Malpresentation, IUCD</p>
<ol start="12">
<li>In which of the following conditions will a midwife consider performing a vacuum extraction in a term pregnancy with a cephalic presentation?</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Intrauterine fetal death at full cervical dilatation
b) Severe pre-eclampsia at full cervical dilatation
c) Fetal distress at 8cm cervical dilatation
d) Cord prolapse at 5cm cervical dilatation</p>
<ol start="13">
<li>The precaution that a midwife should take to avoid retained placenta is: -</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Discourage premature pushing during first stage
b) Administer intravenous fluids during childbirth
c) Administration of oxytocin following childbirth
d) Administer prophylactic antibiotics during labor</p>
<ol start="14">
<li>Mrs. X was admitted at the hospital at 9 a.m and diagnosed with features of severe pre-eclampsia and started on the recommended Magnesium Sulphate as per national protocols. She was monitored and had a successful spontaneous vaginal birth at 1 p.m though she experienced a fit at 4 p.m while still on the Magnesium Sulphate treatment. Which of the following is the correct management option for Mrs. X?</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Continue with Magnesium Sulphate maintenance dose and stop at 9am the following day
b) Continue with Magnesium Sulphate maintenance dose and stop at 1pm the following day
c) Continue with Magnesium Sulphate maintenance dose and stop at 4pm the following day
d) Continue with Magnesium Sulphate maintenance dose and stop at 1am the following day</p>
<ol start="15">
<li>During monitoring of labor progress of a woman using a partograph, which of the following fetal wellbeing indicators are reassuring to a midwife?</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Fetal heart rate 120-160 beats/minute, Moulding +, Clear liquor
b) Fetal heart rate 160-180 beats/minute, Moulding 2+, Fetal descent 2/5
c) Moulding 3+, Fetal heart rate 110 beats/minute, Meconium stained liquor
d) Meconium stained liquor, Moulding 2+, Fetal descent 0/5</p>
<ol start="16">
<li>One of the following statement is true regarding obstetric hemorrhages</li>
</ol>
<p>a) In every case of placental abruption, be prepared for postpartum hemorrhage
b) Conduct digital vaginal examination first to diagnose placenta praevia
c) If cervix is fully dilated but fetal heart rate is abnormal, do not attempt vaginal delivery
d) Always commence IV fluids then secure airway and breathing in hemorrhage</p>
<ol start="17">
<li>Which of the following statements is true about newborn resuscitation?</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Stimulate newborn using a dry warm cloth then clear meconium-filled airway
b) Start chest compressions if newborn is not breathing with open airway immediately
c) Continue ventilation for 1 minute if heart rate is more than 60 beats/minute
d) Consider chest compressions if heart rate is more than 60 but less than 100/minute</p>
<p>Page 3 of 7</p>
<p>KMTC/QP-8/EPS</p>
<ol start="18">
<li>
<p>Oral sex is not recommended for mother during their postpartum period because of:
a) Possible abdominal pain
b) Infection to the spouse
c) Embolism due to blowing air in to uterus
d) Pain in the perineum</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The possible congenital problem that may result from a ovum that is fertilized by more than one sperm is:
a) Blastocyst
b) Hydatidiform mole
c) Mongolism
d) Intra uterine growth restriction</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>A midwife should expect a woman who develops deep venous thrombosis to be given heparin sodium to:-
a) Prevent further enlargement of the vein
b) Reduce calf tissue oedema
c) Improve the venous return
d) Dissolve the thrombosis</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>First stage of labour is defined as a period from onset of:-
a) Labour pains to full dilatation
b) Labour pains to full crowning of the head
c) True labour to birth of the baby
d) True labour to full dilation of the cervix</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>A condition in which a midwife prepares a mother for emergency cesarean section include:-

c) Placenta previa, placenta abruption, uterine rupture, uterine fibroids

b) Promethazine
c) Quinine
d) Ompeprazole</p>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="community-health">COMMUNITY HEALTH<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#community-health" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="section-1-multiple-choice-questions-40-marks">SECTION 1: MULTIPLE CHOICE QUESTIONS (40 MARKS)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#section-1-multiple-choice-questions-40-marks" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>
<p>Developmental tasks of a launching centre family include:
a) Child socialization
b) Cultivating leisure time activities
c) Releasing children as young adults
d) Open parent-child communication</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>A process by which a community is made alert of its problems and the available resources, such as, manpower, money, materials, ideas and time is community:
a) Sensitization
b) Awareness
c) Mobilization
d) Participation</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The ability of a person to make and maintain acceptable interactions with other people in a community is:
a) Physical health
b) Mental health
c) Social health
d) Emotional health</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Preventive health services offered at a MCH/FP clinic include:
a) Exercises, good nutritional practises, personal hygiene,
b) Growth monitoring and screening, breast examination
c) Diagnosis and treatment of minor ailments and referral
d) Immunization, health education, antenatal and postnatal care</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Functions of the division of family health included in the county department of health are:
a) Referral and ambulance, health facilities, mental health
b) Occupational health, waste management, vector control
c) Nutritional services, expanded program of immunization, adolescent health
d) Infrastructure and maintenance, procurement, health facility management</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The following Act of the Kenyan laws prescribes food safety:
a) Nurses act CAP 257
b) Public health Act CAP 242
c) Clinical officers act CAP 241
d) Medical practitioners act CAP 253</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The role of a community health nurse that involves advising other health care providers on the needs of the community is:
a) Planner
b) Manager
c) Advocator
d) Educator</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The following vaccines are administered to infants at ten (10) weeks:
a) Measles, BCG, rotavirus vaccine
b) Vitamin A, oral polio 2(OPV 2), pneumococcal
c) Oral Polio (OPV 2), pneumococcal, pentavalent 2
d) Inactivated polio vaccine (IPV), measles, hepatitis B</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>KMTC/QP-08/EPS</p>
<ol start="9">
<li>
<p>The following is used to measure success in health education process;
a) Changes in behavior and attitudes.
b) The ability to incorporate advance technology
c) The willingness of all stakeholders to support the program.
d) The attentiveness of the audience during health education.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>A concept of Primary Health Care (PHC) that ensures rural health services are provided by methods that are within the social cultural norms of a community is:-
a) Accessibility
b) Affordability
c) Availability
d) Acceptability</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The following are additional elements of primary health care (PHC) added by the Kenyan government;
a) Education, nutrition, local disease control, malaria control
b) Mental health, dental health, community based rehabilitation, malaria control
c) Family planning, expanded programme of immunization, essential drug supply, local disease control
d) Community based rehabilitation, safe water supply, nutrition and adequate food supply, mental health</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Resources targeted during Community mobilization include the following;
a) Money, land, materials, manpower
b) Money, materials, time, manpower.
c) Community participation, time, manpower.
d) Community participation, money and land.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Level one health care delivery in Kenya is provided by.
a) The family and community members.
b) The enrolment community health workers
c) Trained public health nurses
d) Traditional birth attendants.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The drug of choice in the treatment of schistosomiasis is;
a) Praziquantel 40mg/kg body weight as a single dose
b) Metronidazole tabs 400mg tds x5/7
c) Amphotericin B 3mg/kg body weight for 10days
d) Amoxicillin caps 500mg tds x5/7</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Incubation period is;
a) The time of infection and death
b) Appearance of clinical symptoms and death
c) Time of infection and appearance of antibodies
d) The time of infection and appearance of clinical symptoms</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The correct stages in the progression of measles are:-
a) Prodromal phase, eruptive phase, post-measles phase
b) Pre-measles phase, prodromal phase, post-measles phase
c) Pre-measles phase, eruptive phase, post-measles phase
d) Eruptive phase, pre-measles phase, post-measles phase</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>Page 3 of 7</p>
<p>KMTC/QP-08/EPS</p>
<ol start="17">
<li>
<p>Environmental factors whose effects are commonly expressed as stress, depression, hysteria are;
a) Chemical hazards
b) Physical hazards
c) Psychological hazards
d) Biological hazards</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>You are a Nurse working with local NGO and you have been assigned to conduct community dialogue in village X. What will be your first action?
a) Meet with the local leaders in the village
b) Develop and action plan
c) Do a transect walk in the village
d) Prioritize community needs</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The following preventive/promotive services are appropriate to Late Childhood (6-12 yrs) cohort.
a) Antenatal care, breastfeeding
b) Vaccination, growth monitoring
c) Supplementary feeding, de-worming
d) Nutritional care, insecticide treated net use</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The fundamental learning process aimed at changing behaviour and attitude with respect to health practices thus involves family individual and community is :-
a) Health analysis
b) Health education
c) Health promotion
d) Family counseling</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Voluntary action in health education is;
a) The process of creating favorable conditions for learning in the community
b) An interactive process aimed at changing behavior specific messages and different communication approaches
c) The taking up behavioral measures by a person to achieve an intended health effect with full understanding and acceptance of purposes
d) The process of sharing ideas, information, knowledge, and experience among people for behavior change</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Health promotion implies;
a) Offering curative services to the community
b) Detecting diseases in good time
c) Enabling people to increase control over their heath
d) Averting diseases in specific populations</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The correct sequence of activities during community diagnosis is;
a) Planning of the survey, exploration, pretesting survey tools, report writing, dissemination and community action
b) Exploration, planning of the survey, pretesting survey tools, report writing, dissemination and community actions
c) Pretesting survey tools, planning of the survey, exploration, report writing, dissemination and community action
d) Exploration, pretesting survey tools, planning of the survey, report writing, dissemination and community action.</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>Page 4 of 7</p>
<p>KMTC/QP-08/EPS</p>
<ol start="24">
<li>Which of the following participatory methods would best be used to get information from the opinion leaders in the community?</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Focus group discussion
b) Transect walk
c) Seasonal calendars
d) Key informant interviews</p>
<ol start="25">
<li>A rural health unit under the Ministry of health that is charged with the responsibility of providing services to a particular catchment area is;</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Clinic
b) Dispensary
c) Health centre
d) Sub-county hospital</p>
<ol start="26">
<li>The principle of ethical reasoning that allows a home based care client to assume the right to make own decisions about their health is :-</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Veracity
b) Fidelity
c) Autonomy
d) Paternalism</p>
<ol start="27">
<li>The mode of action for combined oral contraceptive is;</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Ovulation inhibition, thickening of mucus
b) Slippery mucus, delayed ovulation
c) Slowed motility, enhanced ovulation
d) Increased motility in uterine tubes, thickening of endometrium</p>
<ol start="28">
<li>The following family planning method involves recording body temperature with observing cervical mucus;</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Fertility awareness method
b) Symptom-thermal method
c) Lactation amenorrhea method
d) Basal Body Temperature method</p>
<ol start="29">
<li>A nurse is teaching a client with genital herpes. Education for this client should include an explanation of</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Why the disease is transmittable only when visible lesions are present
b) The need for the use of petroleum products.
c) Option of disregarding safer-sex practices now that he's already infected.
d) The importance of informing his partners of the disease.</p>
<ol start="30">
<li>An appropriate nursing intervention to provide emotional support to a patient with an STD is to;</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Use concerned listening when the patient expresses negative feelings.
b) Reassure the patient that the disease is curable with appropriate treatment.
c) Offer many alternatives that the patient can use to change sexual relationships.
d) Help the patient who is an innocent sexual partner forgive the infecting partner.</p>
<p>Page 5 of 7</p>
<p>KMTC/QP-08/EPS</p>
<ol start="31">
<li>The ability of a disease causing agent to penetrate, multiply and produce some detectable change (establish itself) in the host is;</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Infectivity
b) Stability
c) Virulence
d) Pathogenicity</p>
<ol start="32">
<li>A therapeutic intervention applied on mentally ill persons that involves exposing the patient to dreaded or fearful stimuli while preventing avoidant behavior is;</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Flooding
b) Desensitization
c) Modeling
d) Reattribution</p>
<ol start="33">
<li>The abnormal sexual behavior in which a man fantasizes having sex with a woman whom he has been observing undress is</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Exhibitionism
b) Voyeurism
c) Frotteurism
d) Transvestitism</p>
<ol start="34">
<li>A mental health nurse who asks a psychiatric patient for their three names, name of the hospital they are in and the month of the year will be assessing for;</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Perception
b) Attention
c) Abstraction
d) Orientation</p>
<ol start="35">
<li>A statistical measure in which the numerator is not related to the denominator is: -</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Rate
b) Ratio
c) Proportion
d) Percentage</p>
<ol start="36">
<li>The persistent occurrence of a disease at a low to moderate level in a community is known as: -</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Pandemic level
b) Sporadic level
c) Endemic level
d) Epidemic level</p>
<ol start="37">
<li>A step in community health nursing programs that involves testing whether the expected outcome has been achieved is?</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Planning
b) Evaluation
c) Assessment
d) Implementation</p>
<ol start="38">
<li>Which of the following approaches is likely to be most effective for a school nurse to use in working with families in a respectful and nondiscriminatory manner?</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Being professional and sensitive to factors related to socioeconomic, ethnic, and cultural backgrounds
b) Attempting to discover pertinent characteristics of families' backgrounds before meeting with them</p>
<p>KMTC/QP-08/EPS</p>
<p>c) Acknowledging obvious differences in background right away and using humor to put families at ease
d) Remaining friendly and curious while asking specific questions about families' backgrounds and living situations</p>
<ol start="39">
<li>
<p>Screening in school health services involves;
a) Treatment of the sick school children
b) Taking note of any unusual signs or symptoms
c) Referral of sick pupils for further treatment
d) Health examination to determine the pupil’s health status</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>For this question, indicate whether the given statements are TRUE or FALSE
(i) Adequate community involvement is the reason why most projects in the community fails to continue when the donor funding is withdrawn
(ii) Sufficient political commitment has demonstrated movement toward attainment of health for all in developing countries</p>
</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="section-2-short-answer-questions-40-marks">SECTION 2: SHORT ANSWER QUESTIONS (40 MARKS)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#section-2-short-answer-questions-40-marks" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol start="41">
<li>Outline five (5) components of the high priority package according to the Kenya Essential Package of Health (KEPH) (5 marks)</li>
<li>Outline four (4) characteristics of a healthy community (4 marks)</li>
<li>State four (4) ways through which home accidents can be prevented in the family (4 marks)</li>
<li>Explain three (3) portals of entry of disease causing agents into the human body (6 marks)</li>
<li>Outline five (5) factors that influence nutrition status of a community (5 marks)</li>

<li>Explain three (3) roles of a community health nurse in the prevention of Covid-19 disease (5 marks)</li>
<li>State five (5) factors than can hinder effective community participation (5 marks)</li>
</ol>

<ol>
<li>The practice of nursing directed towards maximizing the health and well-being of all individuals within a family system is referred to as;</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Family nursing
b) Family health care
c) Family nursing process
d) Family health nursing</p>
<ol start="2">
<li>The incubation period is the interval between: -</li>
</ol>
<p>a) The time of infection and death
b) Appearance of clinical symptoms and death
c) The time of infection and appearance of clinical symptoms
d) Time of infection and appearance of antibodies</p>
<ol start="3">
<li>The following theory proposes that families go through competitive social systems, existence of family relationships with negotiations and problem solving;</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Conflict theory
b) Exchange theory
c) Structural theory
d) Developmental theory</p>
<ol start="4">
<li>Assessment of a community by a nurse involves?</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Identifying present and potential needs and resources related to health of patients.
b) Participation in planning for community health nursing services
c) Providing health education to inform the community on health problems
d) Ensuring that all records on reactions of clients, degree of satisfaction, are well kept</p>
<ol start="5">
<li>Post-visit Activities in home visiting include;</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Establishing trust and rapport with the patient and the family so that there can be a positive interpersonal relationship
b) Gathering information regarding the location of the house, distance from your health facility and the physical address
c) Recording and reporting important events of the home visits and sharing the reports with the appropriate stakeholders
d) Sharing information with the patient on the reason and purposes for home visits.</p>
<ol start="6">
<li>Efforts to detect and treat a health problem at its earliest possible state are referred to as:</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Tertiary prevention
b) Primary prevention
c) Secondary prevention
d) Rehabilitative prevention</p>
<ol start="7">
<li>One of the following is a reason for evaluation in health promotion?</li>
</ol>
<p>a) To identify ways in which fewer resources can be used to achieve fewer objectives
b) To reflect on our practice and process to ensure that we are promoting and protecting health
c) To establish ways in which more resources can be used to achieve fewer objectives
d) To determine ways in which community participation can be limited.</p>

<ol start="8">
<li>
<p>The following is an enabling factor in behavior change process:
a) Motivation to change from external means
b) Practicing trial behavior among communities that require change
c) Community networks that allow easy access to care
d) Effective communication and involvement of communities in assessment</p>
</li>

a) Referring cases or patients to the midwife
b) Providing technical guidance to the midwife
c) Proving nursing care to cases referred by the midwife
d) Formulating and implementing training programs for midwives</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Passive natural immunity is conveyed through: -
a) Having a clinical disease
b) Administration of tetanus toxoid
c) Getting serum immunoglobulin
d) Getting immunoglobulin from breast milk</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>One of the following statements describe Direct Contact Transmission: -
a) Respiratory droplets carrying infectious pathogens
b) Dissemination of droplet nuclei containing infectious agents
c) Microbes transferred through contaminated intermediate object
d) Microbes directly transferred from an infected person to another person</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The organism associated with cervical cancer is: -
a) Chlamydia trachomatis.
b) Candida albicans.
c) Trichomonas vaginalis
d) Human papillomavirus</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Benefits of intra-uterine contraceptive device include;
a) Protection against STIs and HIV/AIDS
b) Long-term and permanent protection
c) Destroys spermatozoa and fertilized ovum
d) Highly effective and long-term protection</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The following appropriate drug prescribed for a patient suffering from gonorrhea is:
a) Tetracycline
b) Ceftriaxone
c) Penicillin
d) Levofloxacin</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The areas of interest in environmental health include;
a) Preventive and promotive of Health services
b) Curative and rehabilitation Health services
c) Monitoring of livestock for quality meat
d) Teaching people to grow enough food for nutrition</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>A nurse is teaching a client with genital herpes. Education for this client should include an explanation of
a) The need for the use of petroleum products.
b) The importance of informing his partners of the disease.
c) Why the disease is transmittable only when visible lesions are present.</p>
</li>
</ol>

<ol start="17">
<li>When teaching a patient infected with HIV regarding transmission of the virus to others, which of the following statements made by the patient would identify a need for further education:</li>
</ol>
<p>a) I will need to isolate any utensils I use so as not to infect my family."
b) I will notify all of my sexual partners so they can get tested for HIV."
c) Unprotected sexual contact is the most common mode of transmission."
d) I do not need to worry about spreading this virus to others by sweating at the gym."</p>
<ol start="18">
<li>Functions of the division of clinical services at the county include:-</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Nutritional services, provision of EP1, adolescent and sexual health services
b) Occupational health, waste management and vector control
c) Referral and ambulance services provision, management of common conditions
d) Infrastructure maintenance, procurement, health facility management</p>
<ol start="19">
<li>Physical health is;</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Ability to learn and think clearly
b) Ability to make and maintain acceptable interactions with other people
c) Ability to handle day-to-day events and obstacles, work towards important goals
d) The presence of body parts in their normal anatomical and physiological functioning</p>
<ol start="20">
<li>An example of guiding principles in school health services include;</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Equality, technology
b) Privacy and confidentiality
c) Discrimination and availability
d) Access to information and injustice</p>
<ol start="21">
<li>Occupational health and safety is a broad discipline concerned with the;</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Health staff development
b) Hygiene and sanitation
c) Community health and development
d) Interaction between health and work.</p>
<ol start="22">
<li>Proper sanitation facilities in the community help to;</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Prevent disease
b) Improve health status
c) Promote health
d) Improve quality of air.</p>
<ol start="23">
<li>A person’s belief in his ability to change his behavior is?</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Locus of control
b) Self determination
c) Health promotion
d) Self-efficacy</p>
<ol start="24">
<li>A sexual offence in which an offender causes penetration with the sexual organ into a child is: -</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Incest
b) Defilement
c) Indecent act
d) Attempted rape</p>

d) A person's affection and sexual attraction to other persons</p>

a) Self administered action resulting in death.

a) Perpetuating factors
b) Predisposing factors
c) Precipitating factors
d) Aggravating factors</p>
</li>

b) Shigella dysentriae
c) Staphylococcus aureus
d) Streptococcus pyogens</p>

c) Dengue fever
d) Typhoid fever</p>
</li>

a) Ceiling fans
b) Open windows
c) Ventilation fans in the kitchen and bathroom
d) A mechanical system that exhausts air to the outside</p>
</li>

c) 2 doses; at the 3rd and 4th month vaccination visits

</li>

b) Bacillus Calmette Guerine, Oral Polio, Pentavalent
c) Tetanus Toxoid, Hepatitis B, Measles/Rubella
d) Inactivated Polio, Measles, Hepatitis</p>

<li>The measure for the number of people in a population who have a particular disease or attribute at a given point in time is referred to as;</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Prevalence
b) Incidence
c) Attack rate
d) Proportion</p>
<ol start="35">

</ol>
<p>a) The risk factors associated with the appearance of a disease
b) How cases of the condition of interest spread across a population differently

d) Antecedent events are associated with the appearance of a disease or condition</p>
<ol start="36">
<li>One function of the educational sub-system in promoting community health is to;</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Change behavior and improve individual and community’s health practices
b) Assess environmental sanitation to protects the community from diseases
c) Help in organizing activities for motivating people to adopt positive health practices.
d) Bring together institutions providing continuous and comprehensive health services</p>
<ol start="37">
<li>The priority nursing role in care giving for a family is: -</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Teaching that not all issues raised can be resolved

c) Carrying out assessments of clients before referral to health facility
d) Conducting initial counselling and referring client for psychological services</p>
<ol start="38">
<li>The type of power based upon admiration and respect for an individual as a person is referred to as;</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Expert power
b) Referent power
c) Legitimate power
d) Information power</p>
<ol start="39">

</ol>
<p>a) Leadership

d) Coordination</p>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="section-2-short-answer-questions-40-marks">SECTION 2- SHORT ANSWER QUESTIONS (40 MARKS)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#section-2-short-answer-questions-40-marks" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>

<li>Outline five (5) Community Health Activities (5 marks)</li>
<li>State the four (4) heat treatment methods of destroying micro-organism in food (4 marks)</li>

<li>Outline five (5) factors than can hinder community participation (5 marks)</li>
<li>Describe the pathogenesis of poliomyelitis (5 marks)</li>
<li>State five (5) factors influencing adult learning (5 marks)</li>
<li>State four (4) effects of nosocomial infections to patients (4 marks)</li>
<li>Explain three (3) barriers to male involvement in reproductive health (6 marks)</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="section-3-long-answer-question-20-marks">SECTION 3- LONG ANSWER QUESTION (20 MARKS)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#section-3-long-answer-question-20-marks" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol start="49">
<li>You have been deployed as a Nurse in a health center within your sub-County whereby you will be required to assist in planning for all primary health care activities within the immediate community.</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Outline five (5) pillars of PHC that will guide your daily activities (5 marks)
b) State five (5) qualities that you will consider in selection of your community health workers (5 marks)
c) Describe characteristics of a successful primary health care concept (10 marks)</p>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="final-qualifying-examination-for-certificate-in-community-health-nursing">FINAL QUALIFYING EXAMINATION FOR CERTIFICATE IN COMMUNITY HEALTH NURSING<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#final-qualifying-examination-for-certificate-in-community-health-nursing" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="instructions">INSTRUCTIONS<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#instructions" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>This paper consists of:</li>
</ol>
<ul>
<li>Section 1 (40 Multiple Choice Questions)</li>
<li>Section 2 (8 Short Answer Questions)</li>
<li>Section 3 (1 Long Answer Question)</li>
</ul>
<ol start="2">
<li>
<p>Attempt <strong>ALL</strong> Questions</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Write the <strong>EXAMINATION NUMBER</strong> given on all the answer sheets provided and on the question paper.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Ensure that all examination answer scripts are handed in at the end of the examination</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Ensure you sign the examination register provided</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p><strong>EXAMINATION NUMBER</strong> ...</p>
<p>Scanned with CamScanner</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="section-1">SECTION 1<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#section-1" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="multiple-choice-questions-40-marks">MULTIPLE CHOICE QUESTIONS (40 MARKS)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#multiple-choice-questions-40-marks" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>
<p>Neonatal death occurs
a) In the first 60 days of life
b) In the first 28 days of life
c) In the uterus
d) In the first 12 month of life</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The positive signs of pregnancy include
a) Morning sickness, Hegar’s sign, fetal parts palpated
b) Quickening, jacquimiers’s sign, ballotment of the fetus
c) Amenorrhea, uterine growth, fetal parts palpated
d) Visualization of the fetus by ultrasound, fetal movements, fetal parts palpated</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Second degree tear of the perineum involves
a) The fourchette, bulbocavernosus and transverse perineal muscles
b) Fourchette only
c) Fourchette, pubococcygeus and anal sphincter
d) Fourchette, anal sphincter and rectal mucosa</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Intramural fibroid
a) Is Embedded within the walls of the uterus
b) Lies below the perimetrium
c) Is found within the endometrium
d) Is found within decidua</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>In a single pregnancy, the fundus reaches the umbilicus at
a) 16 weeks to 20 weeks
b) 22 weeks to 24 weeks
c) 26 weeks to 30 weeks
d) 19 weeks to 21 weeks</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Fetal movement are first felt by a primigravid woman at
a) 16 weeks gestation
b) 20 weeks gestation
c) 24 weeks gestation
d) 26 weeks gestation</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Supplementation of folic acid during antenatal period reduces the incidences of
a) Maternal constipation
b) Fetal neural tube defect
c) Fetal infection
d) Miscarriages</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>Scanned with CamScanner</p>
<ol start="8">
<li>
<p>Temporary structures in fetal circulation include
a) The umbilical vein, Ductus Ductus
b) Ductus Ductus, Foramen ovale
c) Hypogastric arteries, Umbilical vein
d) Superior venacava, Foramen ovale</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Rhesus iso-immunization can be prevented by
a) Administration of Anti-D immunoglobulin to Rh (D) positive blood type mother who has a baby with a Rh (D) positive blood type
b) Administration of Anti-D immunoglobulin to Rh (D) negative blood type mother who has a baby with a Rh (D) positive blood type
c) Administration of Anti-D immunoglobulin to all expectant mothers
d) Administration of Anti-D immunoglobulin to Rh (D) negative baby</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The heart rate for a normal full-term infant range between
a) 100 – 140 beats per minute
b) 120 – 160 beats per minute
c) 90 – 130 beats per minute
d) 160 – 180 beats per minute</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Switching off fans prior to delivery helps to minimize heat loss by
a) Conduction
b) Radiation
c) Convection
d) Radiation and conduction</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Deep vein thrombosis in pregnancy is managed by
a) Mobilization, administering heparin
b) Administering heparin, restricting mobilization
c) Administering heparin and vitamin K
d) Administering vitamin K and mobilization</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>When a hand or a foot lies alongside the head, the presentation is said to be
a) Unstable presentation
b) Shoulder presentation
c) Compound presentation
d) Compound unstable presentation</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>In brow presentation, the presenting diameter is
a) Submentobregmatic
b) Submentovertical
c) Occipitofrontal
d) Mentovertical</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>Scanned with CamScanner</p>
<ol start="15">
<li>The sequential mechanism of normal labour is</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Lateral flexion, flexion, descent, internal rotation of the head, crowning, extension of the head, restitution, internal rotation of the shoulders
b) Descent, flexion, internal rotation of the head, crowning, extension of the head, restitution, internal rotation of the shoulders, lateral flexion
c) Restitution, crowning, flexion, descent, internal rotation of the head, lateral flexion
d) Descent, flexion, crowning, restitution, lateral flexion</p>
<ol start="16">
<li>Latent phase of labour</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Starts when the cervix is 4 cm dilated
b) Starts when the cervix is 8 cm dilated
c) Ends when the cervix is 6 cm dilated
d) Ends when the cervix is 3 cm dilated</p>
<ol start="17">
<li>Antidote for magnesium sulphate toxicity is</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Vitamin K
b) Heparin
c) Calcium gluconate
d) Diazepam</p>
<ol start="18">
<li>The effect of anaemia in pregnancy to the mother includes</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Pre-term birth, reduced ability to withstand postpartum haemorrhage
b) Low birth weight, intrauterine hypoxia
c) Intrauterine hypoxia, reduced resistance to infection
d) Reduced ability to withstand post-partum hemorrhage, reduced enjoyment of pregnancy</p>
<ol start="19">
<li>Causes of uterine rapture which can be prevented by a mid-wife include</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Neglected labour, injudicious use of oxytocin
b) High parity, extension of severe cervical lacerations
c) Neglected labour, trauma to the uterus due to a blast injury
d) Perforation of non-pregnant uterus, injudicious use of oxytocin</p>
<ol start="20">
<li>On vaginal examination, descent of the presenting part is determined by the level of</li>
</ol>
<p>a) The presenting part in relation to the maternal ischial spines
b) Caput succedaneum in relation to the maternal ischial spines
c) The presenting part in relation to curve of sacrum
d) The presenting part in relation to the dilatation of cervix</p>
<ol start="21">
<li>The outcome of occipito posterior position in which long rotation with complete flexion occurs during labour is</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Face to pubis birth
b) Face to face presentation
c) Vertex presentation
d) Deep transverse arrest</p>
<p>Scanned with CamScanner</p>
<ol start="22">
<li>The recommended methods of family planning for a post-natal mother with cardiac disease include</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Barrier methods with spermicides, intrauterine contraceptive devices
b) Progesterone only pill, barrier methods with spermicides
c) Combined pill, intrauterine device, progesterone only pill
d) Intrauterine contraceptive device, progesterone only pill</p>
<ol start="23">
<li>Intrapartum prevention of puerperal sepsis includes</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Aseptic technique, repair of perineal tears
b) Aseptic technique, treatment of urinary tract infection
c) Aseptic technique, prevention of trauma to lower extremities
d) Aseptic techniques, treatment of engorged breasts</p>
<ol start="24">
<li>Fetal indication for caesarean section includes</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Cephalopelvic disproportion, locked twins
b) Cephalopelvic disproportion, shoulder presentation
c) Shoulder presentation, locked twins
d) Cephalopelvic disproportion, breech presentation</p>
<ol start="25">
<li>The transitional stages of normal stool of a breastfed newborn 3-4 days is</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Greenish-yellow
b) Brownish
c) Whitish
d) Pinkish</p>
<ol start="26">
<li>Light for dates is defined as a baby who weighs</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Below the 10th percentile of the expected weight for gestational stage
b) Below the 20th percentile of the expected weight for gestational stage
c) Below the 5th percentile of the expected weight for gestational stage
d) Below the 15th percentile of the expected weight for gestational stage</p>
<ol start="27">
<li>The most common microorganism that causes abnormal vaginal discharge in antenatal mother is</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Candida albicans
b) Trichomoniasis
c) E.Choli
d) Pneumonae</p>
<ol start="28">
<li>Immediately the placenta is delivered, a midwife should</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Congratulate the mother
b) Massage the uterus and expel clots
c) Feed the mother
d) Show the baby to the mother</p>
<p>Scanned with CamScanner</p>
<ol start="29">
<li>The management of a tight cord around the neck during delivery is</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Clamping the cord with artery forceps and cutting in between
b) Pushing the body back into the uterus
c) Taking the mother for caesarian section
d) Just observe as the baby advance with each contraction</p>
<ol start="30">
<li>Maternal death is defined as death that occurs</li>
</ol>
<p>a) During pregnancy, intrapartum and within 42 days post-partum
b) During pregnancy, intrapartum and within 60 days post-partum
c) During pregnancy and intrapartum
d) Intrapartum and post-partum</p>
<ol start="31">
<li>The characteristics of lochia rubra is</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Pink in colour
b) Paler, creamy bown in colour
c) Yellow in colour
d) Red in colour</p>
<ol start="32">
<li>Health message given to a post-natal mother who develops engorged breasts after normal delivery include</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Feed the baby with other supplement, express the milk
b) Breastfeed the baby on demand, express the surplus milk
c) Warm compress on the breast, not to breast feed
d) Warm compress on the breasts, take pain medications</p>
<ol start="33">
<li>Health message to share with a mother after repair of ruptured uterus is</li>
</ol>
<p>a) To conceive before one-year ends
b) Not to conceive before two years end
c) To resume sexual activity immediately
d) To conceive immediately</p>
<ol start="34">
<li>The anterior posterior measurements of pelvic brim is</li>
</ol>
<p>a) 11 cm
b) 13 cm
c) 12 cm
d) 14 cm</p>
<ol start="35">
<li>The layers of the uterus are</li>
</ol>
<p>a) The cavity, endometrium, internal os
b) Endometrium, corpus, internal os
c) Endometrium, cornua, internal os
d) Endometrium, myometrium, perimetrium</p>
<ol start="36">
<li>Sagittal suture separates the:</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Frontal bones
b) Occipital bones
c) Parietal bones
d) Sphenoid bones</p>
<p>Scanned with CamScanner</p>
<ol start="37">
<li>
<p>Cephalhaematoma is
a) Present at birth
b) Not present at birth
c) Intracranial effusion of blood
d) Pit on pressure and ross the suture line</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Rooting reflex is
a) Response to stroking of the cheek
b) Sucking and swallowing
c) Occurs in response to sudden stimuli
d) Is elicited by grasping</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The normal newborn baby has a respiratory rate of
a) 24 – 26 breathes per minute
b) 30 – 60 breathes per minute
c) 16 – 20 breathes per minute
d) 20 – 24 breathes per minute</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Cord presentation
a) Is diagnosed on vaginal examination when the cord is felt in ruptured membranes
b) Is diagnosed on vaginal examination when the cord is felt behind intact membranes
c) Is not diagnosed on vaginal examination
d) Cord is hanging on the vulva</p>
</li>
</ol>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="section-2">SECTION 2<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#section-2" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="short-answer-questions-40-marks">SHORT ANSWER QUESTIONS (40 MARKS)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#short-answer-questions-40-marks" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>Explain the THREE major components charted in a partograph that depict the well-being of the mother 6 marks</li>
<li>State FOUR assessment findings during a vaginal examination that indicate pelvic adequacy 4 marks</li>
<li>Explain FOUR indicators of the onset of second stage of labour 8 marks</li>
<li>State FOUR causes of prolonged labour 4 marks</li>
<li>Define ectopic pregnancy 1 mark</li>
<li>Draw a well labeled diagram indicating five sites of ectopic pregnancy 5 marks</li>
<li>Explain FOUR types of spontaneous abortions 4 marks</li>
<li>State FOUR effects of diabetes in pregnancy 4 marks</li>
</ol>
<p>Scanned with CamScanner</p>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="section-3">SECTION 3<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#section-3" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="long-answer-question-20-marks">LONG ANSWER QUESTION (20 MARKS)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#long-answer-question-20-marks" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>Hypertensive disorders in pregnancy could be fatal if prompt and appropriate management is not instituted to a pregnant woman with it.</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Briefly explain THREE clinical features of pre-eclampsia 6 marks
b) Briefly explain TWO effects of pre-eclampsia on the mother 4 marks
c) Explain FIVE reasons why it is important for the midwife to look out for the impending signs of eclampsia in a client with pre-eclampsia 10 marks</p>
<p>Scanned with CamScanner</p>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h1 level="1" id="part-1-multiple-choice-questions-mcos">PART 1 - MULTIPLE CHOICE QUESTIONS (MCOs):<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#part-1-multiple-choice-questions-mcos" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h1></div>
<ol>
<li>
<p>A midwife diagnoses pregnancy when:
a) The woman complains of lower abdominal pain
b) There is amenorrhea
c) Presence of human chorionic gonadotrophin hormone in urine
d) Frequency of micturition</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The reproductive organs that form the external female genitalia include:
a) Labia majora, Mons pubis, Cervix
b) Clitoris, Vestibule, Labia minora
c) Vagina, Labia minora, Cervix
d) Vestibule, Vagina, Clitoris</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The innominate bone consist of:
a) Ileum, Ischium, Pubis
b) Pubis, Coccyx, Ileum
c) Ischium, Sacrum, Coccyx
d) Sacrum, Ileum, Ischium</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The anatomical / true conjugate measures:
a) 12 cm
b) 12.5cm
c) 13cm
d) 13.5cm</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The marginal insertion of the umbilical cord is referred to as:
a) Velamentous
b) Succeturiate
c) Battledore
d) Circumvallate</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The growth and maturation of graafian follicle is determined by:
a) Luteinizing hormone
b) Follicle stimulating hormone
c) Progesterone
d) Oestrogen</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The rationale for establishing youth friendly clinics for the providing specialized reproductive health services is:
a) The youth are at risk of STI, HIV/AIDS and pregnancy
b) Youth are easily approachable
c) Majority are literate
d) Needs less financial support</p>
</li>
</ol>

Scanned with CamScanner</p>
<p>KMTC/QP-08/EPS</p>
<ol start="8">
<li>
<p>According to Focused antenatal care, a pregnant woman attends antenatal clinic for:
a) 3 visits
b) 6 visits
c) 4 visits
d) 2 visits</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Components of birth plan include:
a) Place of birth, ANC card, Transportation
b) Funds, Birth companion, ANC Card
c) Birth companion, Transportation, Funds
d) ANC profile, Place of birth, Funds</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>State whether true or false on the following statements:
i) A midwife is someone recognized as responsible and accountable professional working with women to provide support during pregnancy and delivery.
ii) Midwives are essentially women in the society who assist in delivery.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The outcomes of prevention of mother-to-child transmission of HIV include:
a) Improved child health and child survival
b) Increased stigmatization
c) Prevention of unintended pregnancy in HIV mothers
d) Increased burden to health care system</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Mrs. Tue aged 35 years para 0+0 gravida1comes to ANC Clinic. Her last menstrual period is 12/4/2019. Her expected date of delivery is:
a) 19/7/19
b) 21/7/20
c) 21/1/20
d) 19/1/20</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Folic acid supplements given during the preconception and antenatal period is for prevention of:
a) Microcytic anaemia
b) Neural tube defects
c) Nutritional anaemia
d) Maternal Congenital abnormalities</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>First stage of labour is considered to have occurred from:
a) Dilatation of the cervical os
b) Onset of labour until full dilation of the cervix
c) Contractions of the uterus
d) Contractions until delivery of the baby</p>
</li>
</ol>

<li>The following fetal observations are monitored during active labour:</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Fetal heart rate, Moulding, State of membranes
b) Maternal pulse, Contractions, Fetal heart rate
c) State of membranes, Cervical dilatation, Moulding
d) Contractions, Temperature, Urinalysis</p>
<ol start="16">
<li>The purpose of frequent emptying of urinary bladder during labour is:</li>
</ol>
<p>a) To assess urinary output
b) Allow descent of presenting part
c) Prevent urinary bladder damage in the process of delivery
d) Augment labour</p>
<ol start="17">
<li>Following delivery of the fetal head, the immediate action of the midwife is:</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Encourage the mother to push with every contraction
b) Continue supporting the perineum to prevent injury
c) Ask the mother to breathe by mouth as you check the cord round the neck
d) Cut the cord immediately</p>
<ol start="18">
<li>In the mechanism of labour, the sequence of labour follows:</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Flexion, restitution, Lateral flexion
b) Internal rotation, Complete flexion, Crowning
c) External rotation, Lateral flexion, Restitution
d) Complete flexion, Internal rotation, Crowning</p>
<ol start="19">
<li>The period within 1 hour after delivery is identified as:</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Second stage of labour
b) Fourth stage of labour
c) First stage of labour
d) Third stage of labour</p>
<ol start="20">
<li>Lochia rubra occurs within day:</li>
</ol>
<p>a) 1 - 4
b) 3 - 6
c) 4 - 7
d) 7 - 12</p>
<ol start="21">
<li>The hormone responsible initiation of lactation is:</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Oxytocin
b) Prolactin
c) Oestrogen
d) Progesterone</p>

<ol start="22">
<li>
<p>Pain after delivery as the baby breastfeeds is associated with:
a) Infection of the reproductive organs
b) Involution of the uterus
c) Injury to the reproductive system
d) Inadequate supply analgesics</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Normal head circumference measures:
a) 25 – 27 cm
b) 18 – 25 cm
c) 30 – 34 cm
d) 35 – 37 cm</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>One of the following is an indication of vacuum extraction:
a) High head
b) Rigid perineum
c) Fetal distress in second stage
d) Cephalo - pelvic dislocation</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The midwife would prevent physiological Jaundice by:
a) Administering Vitamin K.
b) Phototherapy
c) Early breastfeeding
d) Providing warmth to the baby</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Rhesus incompatibility occurs when:
a) The mothers blood is Rhesus Positive and the baby is Rhesus negative
b) The mothers blood group is O and the baby is A or B
c) The mothers’ blood group is Rhesus Negative and the father is unknown
d) The mother’s blood group is Rhesus negative and the baby is Rhesus positive</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The commonest causes of puerperal pyrexia are:
a) Pneumonia, malaria
b) Genital tract infection, malaria
c) Deep venous thrombosis, Breast abscess.
d) Mastitis, Pneumonia</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Excessive bleeding after delivery of the baby amounting to over 300mls of blood accompanied by shock is:
a) Antepartum haemorrhage
b) Anaphylactic shock
c) Postpartum haemorrhage
d) Placenta abruption</p>
</li>
</ol>

<ol start="29">
<li>
<p>The following statement is true about prevention of malaria in pregnancy:
a) Pregnant women are more at risk of malaria because pregnancy reduces immunity
b) Malaria complicates severely in pregnancy
c) The infection may cause premature labour
d) Malaria is treatable</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Neonatal death occurs:
a) Within 28 days of life
b) After 7 days
c) Within 7 days
d) After 28 days</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Causes of pre-term labour include:
a) Multiple gestation, Placenta praevia, Congenital abnormality
b) Placenta abruption, Chorioamnitis, Oligohydramnios
c) Malpresentation, Polyhydramnios, Multiple pregnancy
d) Congenital abnormality, Malpositions, Placenta preavia</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The immediate care of a baby suspected to be asphyxiated at birth following difficult labour include:
a) Give oxygen, Clear the airway, Identify the baby
b) Wrap the baby, Stimulate the airway, Intubate
c) Intubate, Clear the airway, Give oxygen
d) Keep the baby warm, Stimulate the back, Clear the airway</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Rescue breaths by ambu bag for a severely asphyxiated baby is at a rate of:
a) 10 - 20
b) 5 - 10
c) 20 - 30
d) 30 - 40</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The correct position for a woman in labour with cord prolapse is:
a) Sitting up
b) Lateral
c) Knee-chest
d) Trendelenberg</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Factors contributing to fetal distress include:
a) Obstructed labour, Poor maternal nutrition, Cardiac disease in pregnancy
b) Prolonged labour, Malnutrition, Fever
c) Prolonged labour, Obstructed labour, Fever
d) Poor maternal effort, Obstructed labour, Prolonged labour</p>
</li>
</ol>

<li>
<p>Risk factors associated with shoulder dystocia are:
a) Fetal macrosomia, Maternal diabetes, Prolonged second stage
b) Oxytocin augmentation, Cord prolapse, Contracted pelvis
c) High parity, Fetal macrosomia, Prolonged labour
d) Diabetes, Contracted pelvis, Nulliparity</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>One of the immediate complications of amniotic fluid embolism is:
a) Fetal distress
b) Maternal distress
c) Disseminated intravascular coagulation
d) Increased incidence of mortality</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The advice a midwife would give to a pregnant woman with two previous caesarean section scar is:
a) Avoidance of future pregnancies
b) Prepare for elective surgery
c) Importance of breastfeeding
d) Prevention of anaemia in pregnancy</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Lightening occurs when there is:
a) Descent of the fetal head into the pelvic brim
b) Sinking of the uterus in the abdominal cavity
c) Involution of the uterus
d) The feeling of being light within the body</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Postpartum hemorrhage is mainly caused by:
a) Tissue, tone, thrombin, trauma
b) Tone, temperature, trauma, tissue
c) Thrombin, time, tone, trauma
d) Temperature, trauma, tone, tissue</p>
</li>
</ol>

d) Vestibule, Vagina, Clitoris</p>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="multiple-choice-questions-40-marks">MULTIPLE CHOICE QUESTIONS (40 MARKS)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#multiple-choice-questions-40-marks" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>
<p>The examination of a patient with a psychiatric disorder should include:
a) Psychological tests
b) Laboratory studies
c) A mental status examination
d) Screening test for stress levels</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Positive symptoms of Schizophrenia include:
a) Hallucinations, delusions and disorganize thinking
b) Waxy flexibility, alogia and apathy
c) Somatic delusions, echolalia and a flat affect
d) Flat affect, a volition and anheclonia</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Substance dependence
a) Includes characteristics of adverse consequences and repeated use
b) Requires long term treatment in a hospital-based program
c) Produces less severe symptoms than that of abuse
d) Includes characteristics of tolerance and withdrawal</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>A person who is always striving to be the center of attention may be diagnosed with personality disorder called
a) Border line
b) Histrionic
c) Antisocial
d) Impulsive</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The age of onset of attention deficit disorder is between
a) 4-7 years
b) 10–18 years
c) 2-4 years
d) Above 8 years</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Regarding pressure sore ulcers
a) Stage one is characterized by erythema with skin breakage on pressure
b) Stage three is also classified as partial thickness wound
c) Stage four the ulcer extends into the subcutaneous tissue
d) Stage two looks like a blister filled with clear fluid</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>One of the following is a principle task in the latent stage of growth and development according to FREUD
a) Toilet training
b) Weaning
c) Learning
d) Sexual identity</p>
</li>
</ol>

<ol start="8">
<li>Planning process can be sequenced as follows:</li>

<li>The following principle of growth and development is correctly defined:</li>

<p>a) Cephalocaudal which states that development proceeds from the center of the body outward
b) Proximodistal which states that development proceeds from top to bottom
c) Orthogenic which states that development progresses from lack of differentiation to increasing differentiation
d) Hierarchical which states that development proceeds from the outward to the centre and simple skills develop together</p>
<ol start="17">
<li>Wilms tumor is the most common malignant tumor of the kidneys and it's characterized by the following manifestations</li>
</ol>
<p>a) A firm mass within the abdomen, haematuria, hypotension, abdominal pains
b) Hypertension, abdominal pains, headache, fever
c) A firm mass within the abdomen, haematuria, abdominal pains, fever
d) A firm mass within the abdomen, anorexia and vomiting, hiccups, abdominal pains</p>
<ol start="18">
<li>In partent ductus arteriosus, there is an abnormal opening between:</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Aorta and pulmonary artery
b) Right and left atria
c) Pulmonary vein and pulmonary artery
d) Aorta and pulmonary vein</p>
<ol start="19">
<li>Organophosphate poisoning should be suspected in a child who presents with:</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Tremors, sweating, excessive salivation, diarrhea
b) Excessive diarrhea, salivation, sweating, dyspnea
c) Pinpoint pupils, dyspnea, sweating, muscle tremors
d) Sweating, tremors, excessive salivation, pin point pupils</p>
<ol start="20">
<li>The main emphasis of community health nursing is</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Treatment of health problems
b) Identification of health problems
c) Identification and assessment of health problems
d) Prevention of health problems and promoting optimum health</p>
<ol start="21">
<li>In epidemiology, the types of analytical studies include</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Observational and experimental studies
b) Cross-sectional and case studies
c) Cross-sectional and observational studies
d) Experimental and descriptive studies</p>
<p>Scanned with CamScanner</p>

<p>Which of the following childhood illnesses are targeted for eradication?
a) Measles, Tuberculosis, Poliomyelitis
b) Acute flaccid paralysis, Measles, Neonatal Tetanus
c) Measles, Acute flaccid paralysis, Pneumonia
d) Measles, Neonatal Tetanus, Poliomyelitis</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The diagnostic stage of malaria is
a) Erythrocytic
b) Sporozoitic
c) Hypnozoitic
d) Oocyst</p>
</li>
<li>

a) Anti-microbial drugs
b) Strict isolation
c) Referral and treatment of contacts
d) Rehydration</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The stage in HIV/AIDS characterized by recurrent respiratory infections and herpes zoster is:
a) Asymptomatic
b) Clinical stage 3
c) Clinical stage 2
d) Terminal stage</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The incubation period of Hepatitis A virus is:
a) 2 - 4 weeks
b) 3 - 12 weeks
c) 6 - 12 weeks
d) 12 - 24 weeks</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The most effective drug of choice for the treatment of trichomoniasis is
a) Metronidazole
b) Tinidazole
c) Azithromycin
d) Fluconazole</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Excretion of drugs is altered in older adults due to the following renal changes
a) Decreased renal tubular function and blood flow
b) Decreased water content in the body
c) Increased total body fat
d) Increase in liver size</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Caring for older people is about offering support and encouragement with the goal of preserving these three aspects of dignity
a) Sympathy, attention, companionship
b) Independence, individuality, autonomy
c) Dependency, worthiness, social inclusion
d) Comfort, dependency, luxury</p>
</li>

c) Increased exposure to vector bone diseases and skin cancer

</li>
<li>

a) The patient getting TB treatment as close to home as possible

d) Patient takes every drug dosage under supervision during the intensive phase</p>

<div data-testid="stHeadingWithActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-1p9ibxm e1icttdg2"><h2 level="2" id="section-1-multiple-choice-questions-40-marks">SECTION 1: MULTIPLE CHOICE QUESTIONS (40 MARKS)<span data-testid="stHeaderActionElements" class="st-emotion-cache-gi0tri e1icttdg3"><a href="#section-1-multiple-choice-questions-40-marks" class="st-emotion-cache-yinll1 e1icttdg1"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" stroke="currentColor" stroke-width="2" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path d="M15 7h3a5 5 0 0 1 5 5 5 5 0 0 1-5 5h-3m-6 0H6a5 5 0 0 1-5-5 5 5 0 0 1 5-5h3"></path><line x1="8" y1="12" x2="16" y2="12"></line></svg></a></span></h2></div>
<ol>
<li>
<p>In shoulder dystocia the cardial sign is:
a) No fetal advancement
b) Turtule sign
c) Macrosomic baby
d) face flushing</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Zavanelli is one of the last resort maneuver in shoulder dystocia, it means
a) Cutting the fetal head
b) Breaking the symphysis
c) Returning the fetal head back to the uterus
d) Allowing normal labor after fetal death</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The denominator in face presentation is
a) Sacrum
b) Mentum
c) Occiput
d) Sincipit</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>State true or false
i) Human milk is the gold standard for nutrition of the human infant
ii) The Mnemonic AVPU in maternal resuscitation means; Alert, Voice, Pain, Unconscious</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>A mother came for antenatal visit on 4/8/2021 with an LMP of 3/2/2021, what is her maturity by date:-
a) 26/40 weeks
b) 32/40 weeks
c) 24/40 weeks
d) 28/40 weeks</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The management of a mother in first stage of labour with placenta previa type two posterior is:
a) Allow progress to normal vaginal birth
b) Emergency Cesarean Section
c) Elective Cesarean Section
d) Await the obstetrician to make decision</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>During an antenatal clinic the mother reports painless per vaginal bleeding. The most likely diagnosis would be
a) Placenta previa
b) Placenta abruption
c) Ruptured vasa previa
d) Placenta acretta</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>The hormonal factors responsible for uterine contractions at the onset of labour are:
a) Increase release of oxytocin and progesterone from decidua at term
b) Formation of oxytocin and oestrogen in the fetal circulation
c) Rise of oxytocin and oestrogen in the fetal circulation
d) Optimum levels of oestrogen and rise of prostaglandins in maternal circulation</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Continuity of care of a postnatal mother after discharge mainly depends on:-
a) The number of postnatal clinic the midwife can make
b) The availability of health facility
c) The ability of the midwife to detect problems and intervene</p>
</li>
</ol>
<p>KMTC/QP-8/EPS</p>
<p>d) The adequate health messages shared with the mother</p>
<ol start="10">
<li>Which one of the following is an indication for giving cardiopulmonary resuscitation in an adult?</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Absence of breathing in the presence of an open airway
b) Presence of circulation in the absence of breathing
c) Presence of circulation in the presence of weak chest movements
d) Patient subconscious in the absence of a defibrillator</p>
<ol start="11">
<li>The reproductive tract fistulae are caused by</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Prolonged labor, Multiple pregnancy
b) Un attended obstructed labor, prolonged labor
c) Surgical injuries, IUCD
d) Malpresentation, IUCD</p>
<ol start="12">
<li>In which of the following conditions will a midwife consider performing a vacuum extraction in a term pregnancy with a cephalic presentation?</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Intrauterine fetal death at full cervical dilatation
b) Severe pre-eclampsia at full cervical dilatation
c) Fetal distress at 8cm cervical dilatation
d) Cord prolapse at 5cm cervical dilatation</p>
<ol start="13">
<li>The precaution that a midwife should take to avoid retained placenta is: -</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Discourage premature pushing during first stage
b) Administer intravenous fluids during childbirth
c) Administration of oxytocin following childbirth
d) Administer prophylactic antibiotics during labor</p>
<ol start="14">
<li>Mrs. X was admitted at the hospital at 9 a.m and diagnosed with features of severe pre-eclampsia and started on the recommended Magnesium Sulphate as per national protocols. She was monitored and had a successful spontaneous vaginal birth at 1 p.m though she experienced a fit at 4 p.m while still on the Magnesium Sulphate treatment. Which of the following is the correct management option for Mrs. X?</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Continue with Magnesium Sulphate maintenance dose and stop at 9am the following day
b) Continue with Magnesium Sulphate maintenance dose and stop at 1pm the following day
c) Continue with Magnesium Sulphate maintenance dose and stop at 4pm the following day
d) Continue with Magnesium Sulphate maintenance dose and stop at 1am the following day</p>
<ol start="15">
<li>During monitoring of labor progress of a woman using a partograph, which of the following fetal wellbeing indicators are reassuring to a midwife?</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Fetal heart rate 120-160 beats/minute, Moulding +, Clear liquor
b) Fetal heart rate 160-180 beats/minute, Moulding 2+, Fetal descent 2/5
c) Moulding 3+, Fetal heart rate 110 beats/minute, Meconium stained liquor
d) Meconium stained liquor, Moulding 2+, Fetal descent 0/5</p>
<ol start="16">
<li>One of the following statement is true regarding obstetric hemorrhages</li>
</ol>
<p>a) In every case of placental abruption, be prepared for postpartum hemorrhage
b) Conduct digital vaginal examination first to diagnose placenta praevia
c) If cervix is fully dilated but fetal heart rate is abnormal, do not attempt vaginal delivery
d) Always commence IV fluids then secure airway and breathing in hemorrhage</p>
<ol start="17">
<li>Which of the following statements is true about newborn resuscitation?</li>
</ol>
<p>a) Stimulate newborn using a dry warm cloth then clear meconium-filled airway
b) Start chest compressions if newborn is not breathing with open airway immediately
c) Continue ventilation for 1 minute if heart rate is more than 60 beats/minute
d) Consider chest compressions if heart rate is more than 60 but less than 100/minute</p>
